summary.p: 15 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 34; Qurʾānic Text: Q 11:110-11:123, Q 12:1-12:38; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 246 x 181mm; Script style: kūfī D.ī; Estimated date of production: 700-900.
The fragment Arabe 348 (d) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1.
The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 34
15 fol. 181×246 mm (1.36). Support: parchment, thick or thin on different sheets, semitransparent, of yellowish color. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation:
I: H1F H2F S H3F / S F4H S F5H;
II: H6F H7F H8F S H9F S H10F / F11H S F12H S F13H F14H F15H.
Text layout: 101×167 mm (1.666), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in black ink. Vocalization: round red, occasionally green dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – circles (type 2.2.1) in yellow paint; for groups of five verses – letter ﻪ (hā) in gold, in the text line; for groups of ten verses – medallions drawn in gold and colors with inscribed numbers of the verses (type 1.A.I – مائة عشر, fol. 2r; type 3.B.I – مائة و عشرون , fol. 4v; type 2''.A.II – عشر, fol. 7v, عشرون, л. 10r, ثلثون, fol. 13r).

Title of surah 12 (يوسف مائة واحدى عشره) is written in gold and inscribed into an ornamented rectangular panel with a tree-shaped medallion on the margin; the ornamentation has been carried out in gold, red and black paint (fol. 5r).
Inscriptions: number of surahs are inscribed in Roman numerals on the upper margins, numbers of verses – on the outer margins in Arabic letters, both in pencil.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold of the second quire; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).

Defects: stains and traces of moisture on the outer margins; minor stains of dirt on the last two sheets; parchment on the edges is crumbling; on some o the pages letters from the opposite pages have imprinted; occasional parchment destruction caused by aggressive ink; tear on fol. 10; ink has peeled off on the flesh sides of some sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “C.K.”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “15 f. 7 lig. \\ S. XI. V. 110 a fin; XII v. 1 a 38” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 12”; on the verso side the name “Monsieur Merlin” inscribed.
Old accession numbers: С.К. (on the wrapping); B. 12 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–4v. Surah 11, verses 110(108) – 123(123)*. Incipit: [فيها ما د]امت السماوات والارض.
Fol. 5r–15v. Surah 12, verses 1(1) – 38(38). Explicit: ما كان [لنا أن يُشرك] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 348d (BNF).
Bibliography: Шукуров Ш. М. Образ человека в искусстве ислама. М., 2004. С. 65–68."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
